org.spongepowered.api.math

Interface Vector2d

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Vector2d>, java.io.Serializable

    public interface Vector2d
extends java.lang.Comparable<Vector2d>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Represent a 2 component vector using doubles. It is immutable and all vectors returned by the methods are new instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector2d abs()
      Calculates the absolute value of each component, returning the result as a new vector.
      Vector2d add(double x, double y)
      Adds the vector components to this vector, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d add(Vector2d v)
      Adds another Vector2d to this one, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d ceil()
      Calculates the ceiling of each component, returning the result as a new vector.
      Vector2d clone()
      Returns a deep copy of this vector.
      int compareTo(Vector2d v) 
      double distance(double x, double y)
      Gets the distance between this vector and the components of another vector.

      Gets the distance between this vector and another Vector2d.

      Gets the square of the distance between this vector and the components of another vector.

      Gets the square of the distance between this vector and another Vector2d.
      Vector2d div(double a)
      Divides each component of this vector by the value, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d div(double x, double y)
      Divides each component of this vector by the corresponding component, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d div(Vector2d v)
      Divides each component of this vector by the corresponding component in another Vector2d, returning the results as new vector.
      double dot(double x, double y)
      Dots the vector components with this vector.
      double dot(Vector2d v)
      Dots another Vector2d with this one.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      Vector2d floor()
      Calculates the floor of each component, returning the result as a new vector.
      long getFloorX()
      Returns the floor of the x component as a long integer.
      long getFloorY()
      Returns the floor of the y component as a long integer.
      int getMaxAxis()
      Return the axis with the maximum value.
      int getMinAxis()
      Return the axis with the minimal value.
      double getX()
      Returns the x component.
      double getY()
      Returns the y component.
      int hashCode() 
      double length()
      Calculates the length of this vector.
      double lengthSquared()
      Calculates the square of the length of this vector.
      Vector2d max(double x, double y)
      Finds the maximum between each component of this vector and the corresponding component, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d max(Vector2d v)
      Finds the maximum between each component of this vector and the corresponding component in another Vector2d, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d min(double x, double y)
      Finds the minimum between each component of this vector and the corresponding component, returning the results as new vector.

      Finds the minimum between each component of this vector and the corresponding component in another Vector2d, returning the results as new vector.

      Multiplies each component of this vector by the value, returning the results as new vector.

      Multiplies each component of this vector by the corresponding component, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d mul(Vector2d v)
      Multiplies each component of this vector by the corresponding component in another Vector2d, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d negate()
      Negates each component, returning the result as a new vector.
      Vector2d normalize()
      Normalizes the length of this vector without altering the orientation.
      Vector2d pow(double power)
      Raises each component of this vector by the value, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d project(double x, double y)
      Projects this vector onto another vector.
      Vector2d project(Vector2d v)
      Projects this vector onto another vector.
      Vector2d round()
      Rounds each component, returning the result as a new vector.
      Vector2d sub(double x, double y)
      Subtracts the vector components from this vector, returning the results as new vector.
      Vector2d sub(Vector2d v)
      Subtracts another Vector2d to this one, returning the results as new vector.
      double[] toArray()
      Returns this vector as an array.
      Vector2f toFloat()
      Returns this vector as a Vector2f.
      Vector2i toInt()
      Returns this vector as a Vector2i, by flooring the components.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this vector in the form "(x, y)".
      Vector3d toVector3()
      Returns this vector as a Vector3d, using the value 0 for component z.
      Vector3d toVector3(double z)
      Returns this vector as a Vector3d, using the provided value for component z.
